feed.title: ShinyTracker
feed.subtitle: Lists and displays detected changes on the RSI "Progress Tracker"

entry.title: Progress Tracker Delta - 2022-06-08
entry.summary: Progress Tracker Delta 459 deliverables listed | 2022-05-25 => 2022-06-08 There were 53 modifications, 2 removals, and 6 additions in this update. Please note that not all removals are intentional; there is currently a bug with how time is entered on the Progress Tracker that can cause deliverables to disappear.

entry.title: Scheduled Deliverables - 2022-06-08
entry.summary: Scheduled Deliverables as of 2022-06-08 There are currently 87 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 43 teams 7 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 4 team(s) within two weeks This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments. The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again. The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable. extra analysis (click me) There are approximately 396 devs (out of ~512, or 77%) with 864 assignments scheduled to work on 87 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 24% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~180 devs (35%) scheduled for approximately 2036 man-days. 31% of deliverables are shared between both projects. 15 deliverable(s) are not currently scheduled to continue work after this sprint: AI - Arcade Machine AI - Untrained Combat AI - Usable System V2 Animatable Gunner Helmet Audio to Animation Toolset Drake Mule Enemy Characters entry.title: Progress Tracker Delta - 2022-05-25
entry.summary: Progress Tracker Delta 455 deliverables listed | 2022-05-11 => 2022-05-25 There were 3 modifications, 1 removals, and 0 additions in this update. Please note that not all removals are intentional; there is currently a bug with how time is entered on the Progress Tracker that can cause deliverables to disappear.

entry.title: Scheduled Deliverables - 2022-05-25
entry.summary: Scheduled Deliverables as of 2022-05-25 There are currently 99 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 45 teams 13 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 11 team(s) within two weeks This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments. The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again. The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable. extra analysis (click me) There are approximately 434 devs (out of ~512, or 85%) with 939 assignments scheduled to work on 99 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 21% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~198 devs (39%) scheduled for approximately 1911 man-days. 33% of deliverables are shared between both projects. 17 deliverable(s) are not entry.title: Progress Tracker Delta - 2022-05-11
entry.summary: Progress Tracker Delta 456 deliverables listed | 2022-04-27 => 2022-05-11 There were 45 modifications, 0 removals, and 0 additions in this update. Please note that not all removals are intentional; there is currently a bug with how time is entered on the Progress Tracker that can cause deliverables to disappear.

entry.title: Scheduled Deliverables - 2022-05-11
entry.summary: Scheduled Deliverables as of 2022-05-11 There are currently 102 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 45 teams 20 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 13 team(s) within two weeks This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments. The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again. The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable. extra analysis (click me) There are approximately 468 devs (out of ~512, or 91%) with 1013 assignments scheduled to work on 102 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 20% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~202 devs (39%) scheduled for approximately 2446 man-days. 32% of deliverables are shared between both projects. 17 deliverable(s) are not currently scheduled to continue work after this sprint: AI - Landing Improvements AI - Navigation Links - Ladders/Ledge Grab Chapter 09 Civilian NPC Movement Improvements Doors/Airlocks/Light Panels Please note that not all removals are intentional; there is currently a bug with how time is entered on the Progress Tracker that can cause deliverables to disappear.

entry.title: Scheduled Deliverables - 2022-04-27
entry.summary: Scheduled Deliverables as of 2022-04-27 There are currently 90 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 38 teams 14 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 13 team(s) within two weeks This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments. The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again. The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable. extra analysis (click me) There are approximately 416 devs (out of ~512, or 81%) with 909 assignments scheduled to work on 90 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 21% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~134 devs (26%) scheduled for approximately 1753 man-days. 27% of deliverables are shared between both projects. 5 deliverable(s) are not currently scheduled to continue work after this sprint: Atlas Greycat Industrial Salvage Backpack MISC Odyssey Probability Volume Encounter Density Refactor Unannounced Vehicle Below are the time entry.title: Progress Tracker Delta - 2022-04-13
entry.summary: Progress Tracker Delta 453 deliverables listed | 2022-03-30 => 2022-04-13 There were 90 modifications, 0 removals, and 6 additions in this update. Please note that not all removals are intentional; there is currently a bug with how time is entered on the Progress Tracker that can cause deliverables to disappear.

entry.title: Scheduled Deliverables - 2022-04-13
entry.summary: Scheduled Deliverables as of 2022-04-13 There are currently 91 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 38 teams 9 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 6 team(s) within two weeks This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments. The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again. The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable. extra analysis (click me) There are approximately 405 devs (out of ~512, or 79%) with 888 assignments scheduled to work on 91 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 20% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~121 devs (24%) scheduled for approximately 1075 man-days. 25% of deliverables are shared between both projects. 3 deliverable(s) are not
